uniol.apt.adt.automaton

Interface State

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DFAState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.AbstractState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.ConcatenateDecoratorState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.KleeneDecoratorState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.LTSAdaptorState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.MinimalDeterministicFiniteAutomaton.MinimalState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.NegationState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.PowerSetConstruction.PowerSetState, FiniteAutomatonUtility.StateWithoutArcs, FiniteAutomatonUtility.SynchronousParallelComposition

    interface State
    A state of a FiniteAutomaton. A state can be a final or a non-final state and has outgoing transitions. Each transition is labeled with some symbol.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<Symbol> getDefinedSymbols()
      Get the symbols for which transitions are defined.
      java.util.Set<State> getFollowingStates(Symbol symbol)
      Get the states that are reached by some symbol.
      boolean isFinalState()
      Is this state a final state?

    • Method Detail

      • isFinalState

        boolean isFinalState()
        Is this state a final state?
        Returns:
        true iff this state is a final state.

      • getDefinedSymbols

        java.util.Set<Symbol> getDefinedSymbols()
        Get the symbols for which transitions are defined. This function will never return the epsilon symbol. Instead, this symbol should automatically be assumed.
        Returns:
        Symbols for which there are transitions.

      • getFollowingStates

        java.util.Set<State> getFollowingStates(Symbol symbol)
        Get the states that are reached by some symbol. This function can also be called for symbols which are not returned by getDefinedSymbols. However, epsilon is the only symbol which may have transitions. All other symbols must reach the empty set.
        Parameters:
        symbol - The symbol which should be followed.
        Returns:
        States that are reached by the given symbol which may be the empty set.
